episode_title: 206 - The One With the Baby on the Bus

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Chandler, Joey, Ross and Ben are there. Ben is sitting in his little rocking seat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who da wenny-Benny boy? You the Wenny-wenny-Benny-Benny boy, yes. (Ben starts crying.) Don’t cry. Don’t cry. (To Ross) Why is he still crying?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let me hold him for a sec. There. (Ben stops crying) Huh? There we are.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maye it’s me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t be silly. Ben loves you. He’s just being Mr. Crankypants.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, I once dated a Miss Crankypants. Lovely girl, kinda moody.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There we go. All better. (gives Ben back to Monica)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s my little boy. (Ben starts crying again)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can I uh see something? (Takes Ben. When he puts him close to Monica, Ben cries. When he moves Ben away, he stops crying. He does that a couple times.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cool.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He hates me. My nephew hates me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, don’t do this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What if my own baby hates me? Huh? What am I gonna do then?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica, will you stop? This is nuts. Do you know how long it’s gonna be before you actually have to deal with this problem? I mean, you don’t even have a boyfriend yet. (Monica glares at him.) Joey, she does not look fat.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier. Chandler has a basketball.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here you go. (Sets a drink down in front of him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh hey Monica. (He holds the basketball in front of Monica.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Waah!! (Chandler moves the basketball away) Goo, goo, goo. (Chandler moves the basketball in front of Monica again.) Waaah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is so funny. Let me see that a sec. (She throws the ball out the window)
(Ross starts to make some gurgling sounds.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you ok, Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know. What’s in this pie?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, I don’t know, butter, eggs, flour, lime, kiwi…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Kiwi? Kiwi? You said it was a key lime pie.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No I didn’t, I said kiwi lime. That’s what makes it so special.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that’s what’s gonna kill me. I’m allergic to kiwi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No you’re not. You’re, you’re allergic to lobster and peanuts and…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ugh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ugh. It’s definitely getting worse.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is your tongue swelling up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Either that or my mouth is getting smaller.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, get your coat, we’re gonna go to the hospital.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is he gonna be ok?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, he’s just gotta get a shot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know, you know, actually it’s getting better. It is. It is. Let’s not go. Anyone for Thcrabble?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Jacket now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What about Ben? We can’t bring a baby to a hospital.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’ll watch him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t think tho.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? I have seven Catholic sisters. I’ve taken care of hundreds of kids. Come on, we wanna do it, don’t we?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I was looking forward to playing basketball, but I guess that’s out the window.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, well, if you do take him out for his walk, you might wanna bring his hat, and there’s extra milk in the fridge, and there’s extra diapers in the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hat, milk, got it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ??? (speech garbled) Thro up a thro thro—a thro thro!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Consider it done.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You understood that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, my uncle Sal has a really big tongue.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is he the one with the beautiful wife?

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is doing some cleaning as Phoebe sits on the couch with her guitar.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Rach, wanna hear the new song I’m thinkin’ of singing this afternoon? I wrote it this morning in the shower.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m in the shower and I’m writing a song. Stop me if you’ve heard it. My skin is soapy, and my hair is wet, and Tegrin spelled backward is Nirget.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Uh, Rachel, sweetheart, could I see ya for a minute?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: F.Y.I.. I’ve decided to pay a professional musician to play in here on Sunday afternoons. Her name is Stephanie… something. She’s supposed to be very good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But what about Phoebe?

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Rachel, it’s not that your friend is bad, it’s that she’s so bad, she makes me want to put my finger through my eye into my brain and swirl it around.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, ok, so you’re not a fan, but I mean, come on, you cannot do this to her.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Uh… (Points at Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no no no no. Oh no no no no. I have to do this to her?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Lather, rinse, repeat, and lather, rinse, repeat, and lather, rinse, repeat…as needed.

content.description: A Street, Chandler and Joey are loaded down with baby stuff, and Ben.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, I don’t think we brought enough stuff. Did you forget to pack the baby’s anvil?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s gonna be worth it. It’s a known fact that women love babies, all right? Women love guys who love babies. It’s that whole sensitive thing. Quick, aim him at that pack o’ babes over there. Maybe one of them will break away. No, no wait, for get them, we got one, hard left. All right, gimme the baby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I got him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, seriously.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, seriously you want him?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: And who is this little cutie pie?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, don’t, don’t think me immodest, but, me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You wanna smell him?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I assume we’re talking about the baby now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah. He’s got that great baby smell. Get a whiff of his head.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I think my uterus just skipped a beat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’d I tell you? What’d I tell you?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I think it’s great you guys are doing this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, we are great guys.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: You know, my brother and his boyfriend have been trying to adopt for three years. What agency did you two go through?

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel has just broken the news to Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But, but this is my gig. This is where I play. My, my name is written out there in chalk. You know, you can’t just erase chalk.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And he’s going to be paying this woman? Why doesn’t he just give her like a throne, and a crown, and like a, you know, gold stick with a ball on top.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Terry is a jerk, ok? That’s why we’re always saying “Terry’s a jerk!” That’s where that came from.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, ok. You probably did everything you could.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, you know what, lemme, let me just see what else I can do. (She goes over to Terry.) All right, look, look. Why don’t you just let her go on after Stephanie whatever-her-name-is. I mean, you won’t even be here. You don’t pay her. It’s not gonna cost you anything.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: I, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, Terry, I’ll even clean the cappuccino machine.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: You don’t clean the cappuccino machine?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Of course I clean it. I mean, I,I will cleeeean it. I mean, I will cleeeean it.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Oh, all right, fine, fine, fine.
(Rachel goes back to Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Done.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Who’s workin’ for you babe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Oh my god. This is so exciting. How much am I gonna get?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well you said that he’s paying the people who are playing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no, no no. I meant that he’s gonna be paying that other woman beause she’s a professional.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’m not gonna be the only one who’s not getting paid.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, but Pheebs…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, huh uh, I’m sorry, no. No, I’m not some like sloppy second, charity band. You know what, there are thousands of places in this city where people would be happy to pay to hear me play.
[Time Lapse, Phoebe is on the sidewalk in front of Central Perk singing.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: When I play, I play for me, I don’t need your charity . (Someone puts a coin in her guitar case) Thank you! La la la la la la la…

content.description: The Hospital, Ross and Monica are waiting for the doctor.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, there’s no way I’m gonna get a shot. Maybe they can take the needle and thquirt it into my mouth, you know, like a thquirt gun.

content.speaker: Doctor
content.text: Hello, there. I’m Dr. Carlin. I see someone’s having an allergic reaction.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Doctor, can I see you for just a minute please? My brother has a slight phobia about needles.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you tell him about my thquirt gun idea?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My brother, the PhD would like to know if there’s any way to treat this orally.

content.speaker: Doctor
content.text: No, under these circumstances it has to be an injection, and it has to be now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tho?
(Monica shakes her head.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s good, have a seat. Um, the doctor says it’s gotta be a needle. You’re just gonna have to be brave, ok? Can you do that for me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok. Oh boy. You are doin’ so good. You wanna squeeze my hand?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (He grabs her hand.) All right, Ross, don’t squeeze it so hard. Honey, really, don’t squeeze it so hard! (The doctor puts in the needle.) Oh, Ross! Let go of my hand!

content.description: A Street, Chandler and Joey are still trying to pick up women with Ben.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a good plan, Joe. Next time we wanna pick up women, we should just go to the park and make out. Taxi, taxi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey, look at that talent. (Motions to two girls waiting for the bus.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Just practicing. You’re good. Carry on.
(Chandler and Joey run to get on the bus.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait-wait-wait-wait!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait! Wait!
[Cut to on the bus.]

content.speaker: Girl No. 1
content.text: Hey, you. He’s just adorable.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, but can you tell him that, because he thinks he’s too pink.

content.speaker: Girl No. 2
content.text: So what are you guys out doing today?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh we’re not out. No, no. We’re just uh, two heterosexual guys, hanging with the son of our other heterosexual friend, doin’ the usual straight guy stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You done?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Girl No. 1
content.text: Oh, there’s our stop.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get outta here. This is our stop too.

content.speaker: Girl No. 2
content.text: You guys live around here too?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, yeah, sure. We live in the building by the uh sidewalk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, look, since we’re neighbors and all, what do you say we uh, get together for a drink?
(They all get off the bus.)

content.speaker: Girl No. 1
content.text: So uh, you wanna go to Marquel’s?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, sure, they love us over there.

content.speaker: Girl No. 2
content.text: Where’s your baby?

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Ben! Ben! Ben!

content.description: The Street, continued from earlier. Chandler and Joey are still chasing the bus.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ben!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s good. Maybe he’ll hear you and pull the cord.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Stop the bus! Wait! Wait! Wait!
(They run around and corner and see three buses pulling away.)
[The Hospital: Monica and Ross are getting Monica’s hand looked at.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure he didn’t break it because it really hurts?

content.speaker: Doctor
content.text: No, it’s just a good bone bruise. And, right here (pointing to the X-ray) is the puncture wound from your ring.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, I’m really sorry. Sorry. Sorry! Hey! Hey! I got my s’s back! Which we can celebrate later. Celebrate.

content.description: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is still singing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: … with the double double double-jointed boy . (A woman carrying a guitar case walks up.) Hey. So um, are you the professional guitar player?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Yeah. I’m Stephanie.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Right. My name was on there (The chalk sign out front), but now it just says “carrot cake”. So, um, so um, how many chords do you know?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: All of them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, so you know D?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, do you know A minor?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, do you know how to go from D to A minor?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok. Um, so does your guitar have a strap?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Mine does. (singing) Stephanie knows all the chords . (makes a face)

content.description: A Street, Chandler and Joey are standing in front of a pay phone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, pick up, pick up! Hello? Transit Authority? Yes, hello. I’m doing research for a book, and I was wondering what someone might do if they left a baby on a city bus. (Listens) Yes I do realize that would be a very stupid character.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi, here’s the deal. We lost a carseat on a bus today. It’s white plastic, with a handle, and it fits onto a stroller. Oh, and there was a baby in it. (Listens) (to Chandler) He wants to talk to you again.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is introducing Stephanie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, everybody, let’s give a uh nice warm Central Perk welcome to…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Terry’s a jerk, and he won’t let me work, and I hate Central Perk !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, to Stephanie Schiffer.

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Thank you. I’d like to start with a song that I wrote for the first man I ever loved. (singing) Zachary .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re all invited to bite me !

content.description: City of New York Department of Health Services, Chandler and Joey run in.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Hi. We’re the guys who called about the baby. We left the baby on ths bus. Is he here? Is he here?

content.speaker: Health Services Guy
content.text: He’s here. (Chandler and Joey hug each other in relief) I’m assuming one of you is the father.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually, uh, we’re both the father. (Puts his arm around Joey)
[Cut to a back room, Chandler and Joey run into it and over to two different cribs with two different babies.]

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Oh, Ben! Hey, buddy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Please tell me you know which one is our baby.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, well that one has ducks on his t-shirt, and this one has clowns. And Ben was definitely wearing ducks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or clowns. Oh, oh wait. That one’s definitely Ben. Remember, he had that cute little mole by his mouth.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Ben, remember us? Ok, the mole came off.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’re we gonna do? What’re we gonna do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, uh, we’ll flip for it. Ducks or clowns.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, we’re gonna flip for the baby?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got a better idea?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, call it in the air.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Heads.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Heads it is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Whew!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We have to assign heads to something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right. Ok, ok, uh, ducks is heads, because ducks have heads.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What kind of scary-ass clowns came to your birthday?

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is standing by the door and looking at Phoebe counting her money as Stephanie is singing.

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Just call me angel of the monring. Angel! Just touch my cheek before you leave me. Oh baby. Just call me angel of the morning. Angel! And slowly turn away. I won’t beg you to stay, with me.
(Rachel goes outside.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here. I thought you might be cold. (Hands her a cup of coffee.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa, look at you, you did pretty well.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Eight dollars and 27 cents. But not really, ’cause I put in the first two, just to, you know, get the ball rolling, and to make myself feel better.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. This whole like playing-for-money thing is so not good for me. You know, I don’t know, when I sang “Su-Su-Suicide,” I got a dollar seventy-five. But then, “Smelly Cat,” I got 25 cents and a condom. So you know, now I just feel really bad for Smelly Cat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you know, honey, I don’t think everybody gets Smelly Cat. You know, I mean, if all you’ve ever actually had are healthy pets, then, whoosh! (Waves her hand over her head.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not even that. I used to do my songs because it made me happy, but now it’s like, it’s just all about the money.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, people missed you in there. And in fact, there was actually a request for “Smelly Cat.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really? From who?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, from me. And I know it’s not your big money song, but it’s my favorite.
(A kid runs up, who looks like, or will look a lot like Phoebe’s brother.)

content.speaker: Kid
content.text: Hi. Uh, did I accidentally drop a condom in your case? It’s kind of an emergency.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Here you go.

content.speaker: Kid
content.text: Thanks a lot. Hey Christine, I got it!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Ross are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just wanna thank you for being there for me today. And I’m sorry I,I almost broke your hand.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s ok. I’m sorry I poisoned you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Hey, remember the time I jammed that pencil into your hand?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Remember it? What do you think this is, a freckle? (Points to her hand.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, what about the time I hit you in the face with the Silvian’s pumpkin?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, man. Oh, remember when I stuck that broom in your bike spokes, and you flipped over and hit your head on the curb?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. But I remember people telling me about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I hope Ben has a little sister.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. I hope she can kick his ass.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna get a new band-aid. Hey, how ‘bout the time I cut the legs off your Malibu Ken?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was you?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They, uh, were infected. He wouldn’t have made it.
(Chandler and Joey enter with what they hope is Ben.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aw, my little nephew. Come here, little one. There’s my little baby Ben. Hey, my little boy. (She picks him up.) Hey, he’s not crying.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, he’s not crying.
(Ben starts crying)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! (Monica looks at him.) There’s still pie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m here. How’s my little boy? Want Daddy to change your diaper? So, did you have fun with Uncle Joey and Uncle Chandler today?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, he rode the bus today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhh. Big boy, riding the bus—Hey, I have a question. How come it says Property of Human Services on his butt?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You, you are gonna love this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Will you hold Ben for a sec? (Hands Ben off and starts to chase Joey and Chandler.) Come here. Come here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stay back, I’ve got kiwi. Run, Joey, Run!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is teaching Smelly Cat to Stephanie.

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, no. I’m sorry. It’s “ smelly cat, smel-ly cat .”

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Smelly cat, smel-ly cat …

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Better. Yeah.

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, much better. And you know what, don’t feel bad, because it’s a hard song.

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You wanna try it again?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Yeah. From the top?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, there is no top. That’s the beauty of Smelly Cat. Um, why don’t you just follow me?

content.speaker: Stephanie
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mmmm hmmm.

content.speaker: Together
content.text: Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, it’s not your fault .
(Stephanie does a little riff on her guitar.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s too much. Sorry.
